articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in G# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in G# (Shape: A)

## Description
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played one after the other instead of simultaneously. In this case, we are looking at a Minor 7th arpeggio in the key of G#, using the shape A.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in a G# Minor 7th arpeggio (A shape) are G# (root), B (minor 3rd), D# (5th), and F# (minor 7th). The intervals in this arpeggio are Root, minor 3rd, 5th, and minor 7th.

## Musical Genre and Flavor
Minor 7th arpeggios are commonly used in jazz, funk, and blues music. This arpeggio gives a soulful and mellow flavor to the music, adding depth and emotion to the harmony.

## Songs
1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "Red House" by Jimi Hendrix
3. "Cissy Strut" by The Meters
